content: Who ever said the media doesn't give Republican's their say? "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson

title: McCain-Cheney-George Will-Gen Patreus on Sunday Talking head Shows

content: General Petraeus is the CENTCOM commander; he is the commander for military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. His job has nothing to do with a political party.
reply: General Petraeus is the CENTCOM commander; he is the commander for military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. His job has nothing to do with a political party.

content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: quote: Originally posted by nspreitler: General Petraeus is the CENTCOM commander; he is the commander for military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. His job has nothing to do with a political party. If you say so ....... He was confirmed for his current position by a vote of 95-2 in the Senate. He has served in the Army since 1974, and he was already a BG when Clinton was in office.
quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: quote: Originally posted by nspreitler: General Petraeus is the CENTCOM commander; he is the commander for military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. His job has nothing to do with a political party. If you say so .......
reply: He was confirmed for his current position by a vote of 95-2 in the Senate. He has served in the Army since 1974, and he was already a BG when Clinton was in office.

content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Who ever said the media doesn't give Republican's their say? It's just the slant they get... If today's media reported on the attack on Pearl Harbor, it might go something like this... "Today, Sunday, December 7th, 1941, the United States was suddenly and deliberately found to be war mongers!... The U.S. Navy deceitfully place the U.S. fleet in Hawaiian waters under a routine Imperial Japanese maritime safety patrol... The Japanese safety patrol thinking that the U.S. ships were in distress and needing aid dropped "safety markers" to denote the U.S. fleet's position... There has been no comment from the current administration, despite repeated inquiries from the press and other news media sources... LOL Respectfully, SUNLINER81
quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Who ever said the media doesn't give Republican's their say?

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: Yeah, those Republican's are dancing their dance now, trying to razzle-dazzle the 'merican public again (it's almost as if they already feel the fires of hell roasting their hind quarters). Of course, they don't have the common decency to play the role of the remorseful sinner. Cheney Says He Favors Limbaugh Over Powell as Model Republican Of course. CHENEY'S TWISTED LOGIC: favor the fat pill-popping drug addict who glosses over your SPECTACULAR failures "for the good of the party." vilify the 4 star, 35 yr veteran who built a career working "for the good of the country" because he endorsed Obama and voted his conscience Mm. NSpreitler has a point abt Gen Petraeus tho. I thought he stated that he didn't realize Powell was a Republican after he stabbed his friend in the back and endorsed the Brother..... No offense Ray, but personally I think the idea that Powel endorsed Obama cause he's a "brother," is a cheap shot. A lot of Republicans endorsed Obama in this election. I don't think you would make that statement about all those others. And there WERE Democrats who endorsed McCain. Should I imply that they did so, cause they didn't want to vote for a "brother?" Dave I guess you were snowbound and couldn't get reception on the tube Dave. But Powell himself equated the preception that people would make the connection. Cheap Shot. Don't be patronizing. The harrassment of the last administration and his Father before him calling them Nazi, out of touch, it's the economy stupid, traitors, still ring in my deaf ears, and still even with them gone, it's more of the same thing that fuels your motor. "I can't deny that it will be a historic event when an African-American becomes president," Powell continued, speaking live in the studio. "And should that happen, all Americans should be proud — not just African-American, but all Americans — that we have reached this point in our national history where such a thing could happen. It would also not only electrify the country, but electrify the world." If the proper job is done I would be proud if he were Chinese. To bring you up to speed. It was a Bush that named Powell Joint Chief of Staff and his immediately boss with Cheney DOD, Sam Nunn Chairman of the Armed Service committee, all three doing a slide shows on the 90' war. Cheney and Nunn are traceable to the family tree. I was kidded that Powell was also a cousin. I don't think he owes the party anything but an arm and a leg. Remember who named him to Secretary of State? With loyalty like this he needs to join Specter and Benedict Arnold. This just shows without Bush, Bush and Cheney he would have retired without a book tour and nobody would give a damn who he endorsed. I take exception to the accusation to make points. This message has been edited. Last edited by: stillkit, Sun 10 May 2009 08:27 PM

content: So Powell's 35 yrs of exemplary service would've meant nothing to anyone if Bush et al. hadn't deigned to reach down and lift him out of obscurity? It's not like those administrations didn't have anything to gain from appointing the first black chairman of the JCoS, Sec of State, etc. They CERTAINLY wouldn't have dreamed of trying to score cheap political points off of Colin Powell's blackness, then OR now. Wow. We should saint those Bush boys right now. The traitorus tragedy of it all...
